subject: Career
title: Homophily: Why We Connect with Clones
description: A micro-lesson that makes Homophily: Why We Connect with Clones usable.

hook.text: Look at your five closest professional contacts. Same industry? Same age range? Same background? That's homophily.

buildup.text: Homophily means 'love of the same.' We naturally gravitate toward people similar to ourselves.

discovery.text: Lazarsfeld and Merton documented this in the 1950s â€” similarity breeds connection across every dimension.

twist.text: Homophilous networks feel comfortable but limit information. You hear the same ideas recycled.

climax.text: Diverse networks are harder to build but produce more innovation, opportunities, and perspectives.

punchline.text: Comfort attracts clones. Growth requires bridges.

quiz.question: What is homophily in networking?
options: The tendency to connect with people similar to ourselves
Connecting with as many people as possible
